result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin G. Blume was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted 3 days credit if revoked.  Defendant is to report to Probation and Parole by Noon on 06/29/2022.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court. Defendant granted a payment plan of $50.00 per month to begin 07/15/2022

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request   Defendant is to undergo a Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

timeConds.notes: The Jail Sentence is stayed until further order of the Court.  The Jail Sentence is on Ct 2 only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin G. Blume

records.addlTxt: 3:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dustin G. Blume in court pro se.. Defendant finalized waiver of right to an attorney after full colloquy.   The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered his plea, knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.  State is in compliance with Victim Rights Law.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 03:40 pm.

12:22 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Dustin G. Blume appeared, pro se  Defendant accepted the State's offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Lifting the no contact to no abusive contact

Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on May 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:19 AM Attorney Melissa S. Inlow appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Dustin G. Blume appeared, pro se.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.    Waived reading of the complaint  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court on behalf of the defendant.  Defendant asking to amend bond to allow contact.  - Granted  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
from Orenda Center- victim has completed safety planning
Initial appearance on April 5, 2022 at 09:20 am.

The defendant shall have no contact with CRB, or LB. or their residence of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Exception for third party contact for child visitation/placement with AB.  .  One time with law enforcement to go to residence to retrieve personal property.
AMENDED 04/05/2022    Defendant shall have no abusive, violent or otherwise disorderly contact with CRB or LB

01:01 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Dustin G. Blume appeared, pro se by video from Clark County Jail.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Court finds probabl cause for the arrest  Initial appearance scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:20 am.
